data.title: 13 Most Popular Athletes from Pakistan
data.meta_description: Who leads the pack in Pakistani sports?
data.text:
Who leads the pack in Pakistani sports?

From the cricket pitches to the hockey fields, who stands out the most?

Discover the most popular athletes from Pakistan, and see how they have shaped the face of their respective disciplines.

Also check out our post about the most popular soccer players from Pakistan.

#1 Shahid Afridi

ğŸ† Sport(s): Cricket

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1980

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: Fastest ODI Century

Shahid Afridi, also known as â€œBoom Boom Afridi,â€ is a renowned cricketer who made a significant impact on Pakistanâ€™s cricket history. His powerful batting and aggressive gameplay have earned him recognition and a massive fan following both in Pakistan and around the world.

His philanthropic activities, particularly through the Shahid Afridi Foundation, illustrate his dedication to helping those in need.

#2 Wasim Akram

ğŸ† Sport(s): Cricket

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1966

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: 502 ODI Wickets

Wasim Akram, also known as the â€œSultan of Swing,â€ is regarded as one of the finest fast bowlers and left-arm bowlers in cricket history. His impressive skills, determination, and leadership have helped shape Pakistanâ€™s cricket landscape.

Akramâ€™s coaching career and commentary duties have cemented his legendary status both on and off the field.

#3 Jahangir Khan

ğŸ† Sport(s): Squash

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1963

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: 10-year Unbeaten Streak

Jahangir Khan is considered one of the greatest squash players in history. His dominance, speed, and fitness during the 1980s helped revolutionize the sport.

He amassed an incredible 555-match unbeaten streak, solidifying him as a legend in squash and Pakistanâ€™s sports history.

#4 Javed Miandad

ğŸ† Sport(s): Cricket

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1957

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: 6-time World Cup Appearances

Javed Miandad is a former Pakistani cricketer who is highly regarded for his intelligent batting and exceptional technique. He represented Pakistan in six consecutive World Cups, displaying incredible consistency throughout his career.

His last-ball six in the 1986 Australasia Cup final is etched in cricket history as one of the most memorable moments.

#5 Inzamam-ul-Haq

ğŸ† Sport(s): Cricket

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1970

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: Over 20,000 Runs in International Cricket

Inzamam-ul-Haq is widely recognized as one of the greatest batsmen to represent Pakistan. His contributions to Pakistanâ€™s cricket victories include the 1992 World Cup win.

Inzamamâ€™s calm composure and ability to perform under pressure make him a respected figure in Pakistanâ€™s sports history.

#6 Imran Khan

ğŸ† Sport(s): Cricket

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1952

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: 1992 Cricket World Cup Win as Captain

Imran Khan, now the Prime Minister of Pakistan, is considered one of the finest all-rounders in the history of cricket. His leadership and unwavering determination led Pakistan to its first and only Cricket World Cup win in 1992.

Imranâ€™s dedication to social causes, including building a cancer hospital in Pakistan, further cemented his legendary status.

#7 Samina Baig

ğŸ† Sport(s): Mountaineering

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1990

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: First Pakistani Woman to Climb Mount Everest

Samina Baig is a mountaineer who has made Pakistan proud by becoming the first Pakistani woman to conquer Mount Everest.

Her courage, resilience, and passion for climbing have inspired many, particularly Pakistani women, to pursue their dreams and break boundaries in male-dominated sports.

#8 Naseem Hameed

ğŸ† Sport(s): Athletics (Track and Field)

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1988

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: Gold Medal in 2010 South Asian Games

Naseem Hameed is a track and field athlete, renowned for her remarkable achievements in sprinting. She made history by winning the gold medal in the 100m race at the 2010 South Asian Games, becoming the fastest woman in South Asia.

Hameedâ€™s accomplishments have inspired many young athletes in Pakistan, particularly women, to pursue their athletic aspirations.

#9 Sohail Abbas

ğŸ† Sport(s): Field Hockey

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1975

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: Highest Goal Scorer in Field Hockey History

Sohail Abbas is a former field hockey player who holds the distinction of being the highest goal scorer in the history of the sport. With a lethal drag flick and incredible penalty corner expertise, Abbas played a significant role in Pakistani hockey for over a decade.

His talent and dedication made him a popular figure in the countryâ€™s sports landscape.

#10 Sana Mir

ğŸ† Sport(s): Cricket

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1986

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: Former Captain of Pakistan Womenâ€™s Cricket Team

Sana Mir is a trailblazing cricketer who captained the Pakistan womenâ€™s cricket team and played a pivotal role in its development. Under her leadership, the team achieved several milestones, including victories in major tournaments.

Her unwavering commitment to promoting womenâ€™s cricket in Pakistan has made her a household name and an inspiration for aspiring female cricketers.

#11 Shoaib Akhtar

ğŸ† Sport(s): Cricket

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1975

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: Fastest Recorded Cricket Ball Delivery

Shoaib Akhtar, commonly known as the â€œRawalpindi Express,â€ is a former Pakistani cricketer who is recognized as one of the fastest bowlers in history. With the ability to reach speeds of over 100 mph, he is known for his fearsome pace and ferocious bouncers.

Akhtarâ€™s career left a lasting impression on cricket fans around the world and inspired many future fast bowlers from Pakistan.

#12 Maria Toorpakai Wazir

ğŸ† Sport(s): Squash

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1990

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: First Pakistani Female Squash Player to Reach Top 50 World Ranking

Maria Toorpakai Wazir is a pioneering squash player who defied societal norms in her conservative region of Pakistan to pursue her passion for the sport. Her determination and resilience led her to become the first Pakistani female squash player to reach the top 50 in the world rankings.

Wazirâ€™s journey has empowered many young women in Pakistan to follow their dreams in sports.

#13 Aisam-ul-Haq Qureshi

ğŸ† Sport(s): Tennis

ğŸ‚ Born in: 1980

ğŸ¥‡ Biggest Achievement: Grand Slam Doubles Finalist

Aisam-ul-Haq Qureshi is Pakistanâ€™s most successful tennis player, who has achieved remarkable feats in doubles and mixed doubles tennis. As the first Pakistani to reach a Grand Slam doubles final, Qureshi has made significant strides for tennis in Pakistan.

His sportsmanship and commitment to both tennis and social causes have made him an admired figure in the countryâ€™s sports arena.
